Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the proposed ban on hollow-point bullets by stating that it "essentially bans deer hunting." It is possible that there are alternative methods of hunting deer that do not require the use of expanding bullets.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the only way to hunt deer is with expanding bullets, which may be a problematic assumption. There could be alternative ammunition or hunting methods that can be used.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the proposed ban would completely end deer hunting. More information and research would be needed to determine the actual impact of the ban on deer hunting.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or solutions to address the issue of mass shootings without completely banning deer hunting. The claim does not explore or consider any alternative approaches.
